p: RAW264.7 cells, a mouse-derived macrophage cell line, were obtained from the American Type Culture Collection (Teddington, UK). The cells were grown in Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM) containing 10% fetal bovine serum, streptomycin, and penicillin at 37 °C in a 5% CO 2 humidified air atmosphere. Cells were seeded into 96-well cell culture plates (2.5 × 10 5 cells mL −1) for NO and viability analyses or in 6-well plates (5 × 10 5 cells mL −1) for RNA extraction, and incubated overnight. Adherent cells were incubated with LPS (0.5 mg mL −1) with (or without) the test CEOs for 48 h (for nitrite and viability measurements) or 24 h (for RNA extraction).
